container.heading: Forensic Laboratories — Personnel Certification and Approval of Laboratory Procedures

para.text: Certified Chemist and Certified Chemical Analyst. An applicant for certified chemist or certified chemical analyst shall:
Hold a bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university with a major in chemistry, medical technology, biology, physics, pharmacy, pharmacology, or forensic science;
Have completed courses in analytical and organic chemistry; and
Have completed a basic training program for certified chemist or certified chemical analyst as set forth in Regulation .02 of this chapter.
Certified Analyst. An applicant for certified analyst shall:
Possess a high school diploma or its equivalent;
Have completed a basic training program for certified analyst as set forth in Regulation .02 of this chapter; and
Identify in the application those specific drug-testing procedures for which certification is being sought and for which training has been received.

section.heading: Approved Training Programs for Chemists, Chemical Analysts, and Analysts.

para.text: Certified Chemist.
An applicant for certification as a certified chemist shall have successfully completed:
The basic training program for forensic drug chemists offered by the United States Department of Justice, Drug Enforcement Administration; or
A training program in the discipline of controlled dangerous substances provided by a forensic laboratory licensed by the Department.

The applicant shall demonstrate completion of the training program referenced in §A(1)(b) of this regulation by providing the Department with the forensic laboratory director’s written authorization for that individual to perform casework independently in the discipline of controlled dangerous substances.

Certified Chemical Analyst. An applicant for certification as a certified chemical analyst shall have successfully completed a basic training program approved by the Department that provides training in the identification of marijuana or marijuana products, or both, cocaine base, cocaine hydrochloride, and heroin using procedures approved under Regulation .04 of this chapter.

Certified Analyst. An applicant for certification as a certified analyst shall have successfully completed a basic training program approved by the Department that provides training in the identification of marijuana or marijuana products, or both, using procedures approved under Regulation .04 of this chapter.

section.heading: Employment, Employment Certification, and Automatic Decertification.

para.text: Employment. An individual applying for certification under this chapter shall be currently employed by:
The Department;
The Maryland State Police;
The Baltimore City Police Department;
The police department or a municipality or county in this State; or
A private forensic laboratory licensed by the Maryland Department of Health that has a contract with a Maryland law enforcement agency to provide testing services for controlled dangerous substances.

Employment Certification. An applicant's supervisor shall certify that the applicant is currently employed by an agency listed in §A of this regulation by signing the employment certification section of the application.
Certification and Automatic Decertification.
Certification under this chapter is only valid when the individual is employed by an agency listed in §A of this regulation.
An individual certified under this chapter is automatically decertified when the individual:
Is no longer employed by the agency that certified employment;
Retires from the agency that certified employment; or
Changes employment from one agency listed in §A of this regulation to another agency listed in §A of this regulation.
An individual shall reapply for certification under this chapter if the individual is:
Rehired by the same agency that previously certified employment; or
Hired by a different agency listed in §A of this regulation.

section.heading: Procedures.
section.text: Chemists, chemical analysts, and analysts certified under this chapter are certified only when performing those drug identification procedures:

para.text: Approved by a forensic laboratory licensed by the Department; or
Contained in the "Forensic Chemists and Analysts Training and Procedures Manual" 1992, which is incorporated by reference.

section.heading: Report.
section.text: A report prepared pursuant to these regulations shall contain the following information:

para.text: The signature of the certified chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst performing the drug-identification procedure;
The name of the person who delivered the material to be tested to the certified chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst;
A statement that the chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst has been certified by the Department to perform the procedures identified in the report;
A statement by the certified chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst that the results contained in the report were reached using procedures approved by the Department;
A statement by the certified chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst concerning whether the material tested is, or contains, the drug identified in the report; and
A statement by the certified chemist, chemical analyst, or analyst that quality control of the drug-identification procedures was performed to ensure the reliability of the procedures performed.
